meanings.definition: To draw a line under (a word or phrase) to give emphasis or indicate special type.
meanings.sent1: She always underlines important words in her notes to make them stand out.
meanings.sent2: The teacher underlines the key points in the textbook for the students to review.
meanings.sent3: The cat underlines its territory by scratching the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work underlines his commitment to excellence.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color underlines the warning sign, making it impossible to miss.

meanings.definition: A line drawn under a word or phrase for emphasis or to indicate special type.
meanings.sent1: The book had many underlines to highlight important passages.
meanings.sent2: The editor added underlines to the document to show where changes were needed.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer used underlines to create a unique pattern on the dress.
meanings.sent4: The underlines in the text made it easier to locate the main ideas.
meanings.sent5: The underlines in the menu indicated the chef's recommended dishes.
